DataElement.preferredName: Bladder Surgery Off-Treatment Transurethral Resection Ind-2
DataElement.preferredDefinition: a yes/no indicator to ask if surgery of the urinary bladder was performed with a special instrument inserted through the urethra during the phase after protocol treatment has been completed.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: related to surgery of the urinary bladder performed with a special instrument inserted through the urethra during the phase after protocol treatment has been completed.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A distensible musculomembranous organ serving as a receptacle for fluid, as the gallbladder.:Used for operative procedures on organs, regions, or tissues in the treatment of diseases, including tissue section by lasers. It excludes transplantation, for which "transplantation" is used.

Concepts.definition: The distensible sac-like organ that functions as a reservoir of urine, collecting from the kidneys and eliminating via the urethra.

A diagnostic or treatment procedure performed by manual and/or instrumental means, often involving an incision and the removal or replacement of a diseased organ or tissue; of or relating to or involving or used in surgery or requiring or amenable to treatment by surgery.

Property.preferredDefinition: Off-Treatment; the phase of a protocol during which a patient does not receive treatment.:(TRANZ-yoo-REE-thral ree-SEK-shun) Surgery performed with a special instrument inserted through the urethra.

Concepts.definition: When a patient is not receiving therapy they are considered off treatment.  In clinical trials, a dosing schedule may require a patient to stop medication for a period of time, then resume, such as 28 days on and 7 days off.
Surgery performed with a special instrument inserted through the urethra.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: actions or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process (NCI).

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The preferred Value Domain to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.administrativeNotes: 2022.12.28 Alt VM added per ticket request CADSR0001837. aj

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Conceptual domain that includes value meanings to be used for Indicator Value Meanings such as Yes, No, Unknown, No Applicable

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A caDSR representation term that is used to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no

Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of either yes or no.

ReferenceDocuments.name: Has the patient received a TU
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has the patient received a TURBT after protocol treatment or biopsy that has not been previously reported
